definitions.definition: the voluntary giving of help, typically in the form of money, to those in need.
examples: financial assistance, aid, welfare, relief, financial relief; Morehandouts, gifts, presents, largesse; historicalalms "we don't need charity"philanthropy, humanitarianism, humanity, altruism, public-spiritedness, social conscience, benevolence, beneficence, munificence "his actions are motivated by charity"Morehandouts, gifts, presents, largesse; alms we don't need charityphilanthropy, humanitarianism, humanity, altruism, public-spiritedness, social conscience, benevolence, beneficence, munificence his actions are motivated by charity

definitions.definition: help or money given voluntarily to those in need.
examples: an unemployed teacher living on charity

definitions.definition: an organization set up to provide help and raise money for those in need.
examples: nonprofit organization, voluntary organization, charitable institution; Morefund, trust, foundation; dot-org "a children's charity"Morefund, trust, foundation; dot-org a children's charity

definitions.definition: the body of organizations viewed collectively as the object of fundraising or donations.
examples: the proceeds of the sale will go to charity

definitions.definition: kindness and tolerance in judging others.
examples: she found it hard to look on her mother with much charity
synonyms: caritas; literarybounteousness "show a bit of charity"

definitions.definition: love of humankind, typically in a Christian context.
